Articles.Content:
The Consolidated B-24 was one of the main bombers of the USAAF during the Second World War, used primarily in Allied daylight strategic bombing missions over Germany alongside the Boeing B-17. It peaked over it's Boeing counterpart with range, bomb load and newer other technology which gave it the edge in Japanese bombing raids.

The aircraft comes with a fully functional bomb bay (Action Group 1), bombs and turret positions.

 

Specifications:

Part count: 369

Bombs: 10

Kerbal Capacity: 11

Craft Download: https://kerbalx.com/Columbia/Consolidated-B-24J-Liberator

 

Thanks for viewing!

 

 

Edited March 21, 2016 by Columbia

15 minutes ago, TedwinKnockman66 said:

Nice!

Thanks!

You know, there's an old joke B-17 crews used to say about the Liberator that said the B-24 was actually the box the Flying Fortress was shipped in. Despite that, this is a pretty nice piece of work. The only big things it appears to be missing are the turrets.
Yeah, and it had a weird hydraulics system, too. There was a comic in The Wild Blue that showed a pilot with an overdeveloped left arm because the controls were unwieldy. But it looks good!
Looks great!  That radiator panel nose looks very smooth.

13 hours ago, pTrevTrevs said:

You know, there's an old joke B-17 crews used to say about the Liberator that said the B-24 was actually the box the Flying Fortress was shipped in. Despite that, this is a pretty nice piece of work. The only big things it appears to be missing are the turrets.

13 hours ago, Dman979 said:

Yeah, and it had a weird hydraulics system, too. There was a comic in The Wild Blue that showed a pilot with an overdeveloped left arm because the controls were unwieldy. But it looks good!

7 hours ago, Mad Rocket Scientist said:

Looks great!  That radiator panel nose looks very smooth.

Thanks! Yeah, the B-17 crews often saw the B-24 as being rugged, fragile and inferior to the B-17, especially that the latter was covered more in press. 

Though I did add the turret positions (Ball gunner, waist gunners), do you mean the turret guns themselves?

The most noticeable turret that's missing for me has to be the top turret, right behind the cockpit (I'm pretty sure the B-24 had one there).

Would you consider adding a few more pictures showing off the plane in detail? Maybe I would be able to get a closer look at the turrets then.

18 hours ago, pTrevTrevs said:

The most noticeable turret that's missing for me has to be the top turret, right behind the cockpit (I'm pretty sure the B-24 had one there).

Would you consider adding a few more pictures showing off the plane in detail? Maybe I would be able to get a closer look at the turrets then.

Oh crap, I completely forgot about the top turret! My mistake. I'll put it in the next update.

I think it was because one of the crew members (Engineer, I think?) was the one who operated it and had another duty to fulfill instead of just manning the guns.

Though I'm quite sure the others are there.
I updated the aircraft, I hope it looks better now.
